title: FFT Calculator – Fast Fourier Transform of Time-Domain Signals

formulas.title: Formula (extracted LaTeX)
formulas.latex: X[k] = \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} x[n]\; e^{-j 2\pi k n / N}, \quad k = 0, \dots, N-1.
formulas.raw: X[k] = \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} x[n]\; e^{-j 2\pi k n / N}, \quad k = 0, \dots, N-1.

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Even/odd decomposition For \(N\) a power of two, the Cooley–Tukey algorithm expresses the DFT of length \(N\) in terms of two DFTs of length \(N/2\): one over the even samples and one over the odd samples: \[ X[k] = E[k] + W_N^k\, O[k], \] \[ X[k + N/2] = E[k] - W_N^k\, O[k], \] where \(E[k]\) and \(O[k]\) are the DFTs of even and odd subsequences, and \(W_N^k = e^{-j 2\pi k / N}\) are the so-called “twiddle factors”. Recursively applying this decomposition produces the classic radix-2 FFT butterfly structure.
